meta.purpose: Shadow medical school mapping - channels that shape patient beliefs before clinic visits

narrative_types.ldl_skepticism: Belief that LDL cholesterol is not causal for heart disease
narrative_types.statin_fear: Fear of statins, emphasis on side effects over benefits
narrative_types.insulin_primacy: Insulin resistance as the sole/primary driver of CVD
narrative_types.fasting_absolutism: Fasting as universal solution for metabolic disease
narrative_types.exercise_compensation: Belief that exercise can compensate for plaque
narrative_types.seed_oil_villain: Seed oils as primary cause of chronic disease
narrative_types.patient_empowerment: Teaching patients to ask better questions

strategic_actions.primary_inspiration: Absorb techniques, format, depth - model your content after this
strategic_actions.absorb_techniques: Learn their hooks, formats, editing style
strategic_actions.translate: Bring excellent English content to Hinglish audiences
strategic_actions.debunk_directly: Create 'What X gets wrong about...' response content
strategic_actions.correct_gently: Address beliefs without naming the source
strategic_actions.monitor: Track for trending topics, don't respond directly
strategic_actions.differentiate: Cover same topics with better evidence

competition_hindi.name: Dr Navin Agrawal CARDIO CARE
competition_hindi.notes: Similar profile - interventional cardiologist. FACC, FESC. 90+ PubMed publications. Gone generalist in content.

competition_hindi.name: Cardiac Second Opinion
competition_hindi.notes: Dr. Mahesh Wadhwani. Surgeon. ESC/ACC guidelines based. EMULATE THIS APPROACH.

competition_hindi.name: SAAOL Heart Center
competition_hindi.notes: Dr. Bimal Chhajer. 3.4M subs, 4B views. Non-invasive alternative medicine. OPPOSITE of evidence-based. Good for identifying beliefs to correct.

indian_mega_channels.name: Fit Tuber
indian_mega_channels.notes: Dominates Indian health attention. Not medical but competes for same audience. His narrative shapes patient expectations.

indian_mega_channels.name: Dr Vikas Bangar
indian_mega_channels.notes: Indian doctor. Lifestyle disease focus. Less cardiology-specific but same preventive health seeker audience.

indian_mega_channels.name: Satvic Movement
indian_mega_channels.notes: Diet-centric, anti-modern-medicine leaning. Strong influence on heart patients via food narratives.

indian_mega_channels.name: Dr Biswaroop Roy Chowdhury
indian_mega_channels.notes: CRITICAL ANTI-PATTERN. Pseudo-medical, extremely influential. Patients arrive with beliefs seeded here. Must actively counter.

inspiration_english.name: Peter Attia MD
inspiration_english.notes: PRIMARY MODEL. User wants: 'Peter Attia speaking Hinglish talking cardiology'. Absorb depth, rigor, systems thinking. Translate to Indian context.

inspiration_english.name: York Cardiology - Dr. Sanjay Gupta UK
inspiration_english.notes: UK cardiologist. Clinical explanations, calm authority. Less lifestyle-heavy than Attia. Excellent patient education format.

inspiration_english.name: Nutrition Made Simple - Dr Gil Carvalho
inspiration_english.notes: Evidence-first nutrition. Not cardiologist but competes for same rational, science-literate audience.

inspiration_english.name: The Proof with Simon Hill
inspiration_english.notes: Deep conversations, evidence-based. More lifestyle and plant-forward. Overlaps heavily in prevention audience.

inspiration_english.name: Dr. Ford Brewer - PrevMed
inspiration_english.notes: Preventive cardiology focus. Calcium scores, lipids. Older demographic, US-heavy. Direct overlap with your niche.

inspiration_english.name: Medlife Crisis - Dr Rohin Francis
inspiration_english.notes: UK cardiologist. Satire and debunking format. Strong educated audience overlap. Study his debunking style.

adjacent_giants.name: Dr Eric Berg
adjacent_giants.notes: MASSIVE reach. Keto-forward, often oversimplified. You will constantly correct beliefs seeded here. Chiropractor, not MD.

adjacent_giants.name: Dr Mark Hyman
adjacent_giants.notes: Functional medicine flagship. Lifestyle cardiometabolic framing. Less rigorous, very influential.

adjacent_giants.name: Andrew Huberman
adjacent_giants.notes: Neuroscience brand but touches metabolism, CVD risk, supplements. Competes for long-form attention.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Sten Ekberg
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Ex-Olympian chiropractor. Most powerful insulin/fasting narrative builder. CVD risk constantly reframed away from LDL.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Ken Berry
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Family physician turned carnivore advocate. Cardiovascular risk minimization is core to his message.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Jason Fung
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Nephrologist. Fasting and insulin resistance focus. Highly trusted by diabetics with heart disease.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Pradip Jamnadas
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Cardiology-adjacent, fasting evangelism. Popular in Indian diaspora. Claims cardiology credential.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Paul Saladino
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Carnivore then animal-based. Lipids and atherosclerosis constantly reinterpreted. MD credential gives authority.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: Dr Chris Knobbe
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Seed oils, hyperinsulinemia. Ideas propagate through other channels. Ophthalmologist.

functional_medicine_broadcasters.name: High Intensity Health - Mike Mutzel
functional_medicine_broadcasters.notes: Functional medicine, metabolic inflammation. Very persuasive, not always precise.

longevity_biohacker_channels.name: FoundMyFitness - Dr Rhonda Patrick
longevity_biohacker_channels.notes: Deep dives, micronutrients, inflammation, CVD adjacent. Strong science veneer, high trust. PhD.

longevity_biohacker_channels.name: Thomas DeLauer
longevity_biohacker_channels.notes: Former trainer turned metabolic explainer. Frequently overconfident, massively influential on fasting/keto beliefs.

longevity_biohacker_channels.name: Siim Land
longevity_biohacker_channels.notes: Appeals to disciplined self-optimizers who later self-experiment into lipid disasters.

longevity_biohacker_channels.name: Leo and Longevity
longevity_biohacker_channels.notes: Aggressive biohacking, hormones, supplements. Cautionary influence but real audience overlap.

fitness_crossover.name: Jeff Nippard
fitness_crossover.notes: Evidence-aware lifting. When he talks cholesterol, BP, supplements - people listen. PhD.

fitness_crossover.name: Athlean-X - Jeff Cavaliere
fitness_crossover.notes: Biomechanics and training. Viewers assume medical spillover credibility.

fitness_crossover.name: Renaissance Periodization - Dr Mike Israetel
fitness_crossover.notes: PhD credibility. Dieting, metabolic stress, cardiovascular strain. Very adjacent to heart risk discussions.

fitness_crossover.name: More Plates More Dates - Derek
fitness_crossover.notes: Hormones, PEDs, lipids, blood work. Accidentally one of biggest lipid education channels. Study his deep-dive format.

diet_wars_channels.name: Low Carb Down Under
diet_wars_channels.notes: Conference clips. LDL denial, insulin framing. You compete with this ideology daily.

diet_wars_channels.name: What I've Learned
diet_wars_channels.notes: Simplified science storytelling. Strong narrative pull, mixed accuracy. Frames heart disease through diet wars.

diet_wars_channels.name: Plant Chompers
diet_wars_channels.notes: Debunks keto and carnivore claims. Audience overlaps heavily with preventive cardiology. Study debunking format.

diet_wars_channels.name: Dr Brad Stanfield
diet_wars_channels.notes: Longevity medicine, statins, supplements, CAC scores. Very adjacent to your core territory. NZ doctor.

diet_wars_channels.name: Nutrition Library
diet_wars_channels.notes: Evidence-heavy nutrition explanations. Smaller but intellectually aligned with preventive cardiology.

high: York Cardiology - Dr. Sanjay Gupta UK
medium: Nutrition Made Simple - Dr Gil Carvalho
